alert.note: Alert for Bradford (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 18 at 5:20AM EST until February 19 at 1:23PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt is occurring. . * WHERE...A portion of northeast Pennsylvania, including the following county, Bradford. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 517 AM EST, Local law enforcement reported multiple road closures in the advisory area. Minor flooding is already occurring. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain has fallen. The rain has ended but rain and snowmelt runoff will continue. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Towanda, Canton, Troy, Wyalusing, Wysox, Ulster, North Towanda, Springfield, New Albany, Overton, Sylvania, Burlington, Franklindale, Monroeton, Le Roy, Wetona, East Smithfield, South Branch, Grover and Sugar Run. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
